etymology.interpretation: Food component signals something edible, while 昏 guides the pronunciation toward hún. Together they label a food item, later specialized to mean wonton dumplings.
etymology.simplification: The food component was simplified from 飠 to 饣; the phonetic 昏 was unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我想吃一碗馄饨(我想吃一碗餛飩)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng chī yì wǎn húntun.
examples.english: I want to eat a bowl of wontons.

examples.chinese: 这家店的馄饨特别鲜美(這家店的餛飩特別鮮美)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn de húntun tèbié xiānměi.
examples.english: The wontons at this shop are especially delicious.

examples.chinese: 他点了馄饨汤和小笼包(他點了餛飩湯和小籠包)。
examples.pinyin: Tā diǎnle húntun tāng hé xiǎo lóng bāo.
examples.english: He ordered wonton soup and soup dumplings.
